newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 22.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Tuesday's Daily Variety:

* Universal Studios Inc is finalizing a $1.1 billion, three-year film-financing facility with Citibank which is structured like Citibank's $1 billion financing for News Corp's 20th Century Fox last year.
* The Oscar-nominated film "Jerry Maguire" team of Tom Cruise and Cameron Crowe are in talks to do a biographic film of record producer Phil Spector at Universal, sources said.

* Following its landmark April 3 decision to award every television station in the country a second channel to launch digital television, the U.S. Federal Communications Commission released details of that decision including a list that tells each station which digital channel it will get.

* Terry Gilliam plans to direct Johnny Depp and Benicio Del Toro in Rhino Films and Summit Entertainment's "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas," based on Hunter Thompson's novel. Then he plans to produce "Defective Detective" with Nicolas Cage.

* Looking to strengthen its executive and programming ranks, Walt Disney ABC Entertainment tapped Rob Dwek as executive vice president of series programming and renewed its top drama NYPD Blue for two more years.
* Sony Pictures Entertainment is blossoming under president and chief operating officer John Calley.
